Uses of Interface
hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.reactive.Observer

  • Packages that use Observer 
    Package Description
    hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.reactive
    This package contains the Reactive main utility class for the reactive programming side of the library, accompanied by some helper classes.
    hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.swing
    This package contains helper methods to interface the Swing's event notification mechanisms (e.g., various Listener interfaces) with the reactive programming's Observable based approach.

    • Uses of Observer in hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.reactive

      Classes in hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.reactive that implement Observer 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DefaultObservable<T>
      An observable + observer implementation which keeps track of the registered observers and common methods which dispach events to all registered observers.
      class  DefaultObserver<T>
      The default implementation of the Observer interface used by the Reactive operators.
      class  DefaultObserverEx<T>
      Extension to the default observer for cases when the observer itself needs to track sub-observers and their close handlers.
      Methods in hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.reactive that return Observer 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> Observer<T> Reactive.asObserver(Action1<? super Option<T>> action)
      Transform the given action to an observer.
      static <T> Observer<T> Reactive.print()
      Creates an observer with debugging purposes.
      static <T> Observer<T> Reactive.print(String separator, int maxLineLength)
      Creates an observer with debugging purposes.
      static <T> Observer<T> Reactive.println()
      Creates an observer with debugging purposes.
      static <T> Observer<T> Reactive.println(String prefix)
      Creates an observer with debugging purposes.
      static <T> Observer<T> Reactive.toObserver(Action1<? super T> action)
      Wraps the given action as an observable which reacts only to next() events.
      static <T> Observer<T> Reactive.toObserver(Action1<? super T> next, Action1<? super Throwable> error, Action0 finish)
      Creates an observer which calls the given functions on its similarly named methods.
      Methods in hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.reactive with parameters of type Observer 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> Action1<Option<T>> Reactive.asAction(Observer<? super T> observer)
      Wraps the given observer into an action object which then dispatches various incoming Option values to next(), finish() and error().
      static <T> void Reactive.dispatch(Observer<? super T> observer, Option<T> value)
      Dispatches the option to the various Observer methods.
      static <T> Observable<T> Reactive.invoke(Observable<? extends T> source, Observer<? super T> observer)
      Invoke a specific observer before relaying the Ts, finish() and error() to the observable.
      static <T,U> Observable<U> Reactive.multicast(Observable<? extends T> source, Observer<? super T> observer, Observable<? extends U> observable)
      Returns an observable which remains connected to the source observable as long as there is at least one registration to this output observable.
      Closeable Observable.register(Observer<? super T> observer)
      Registers an observer for the notification of Ts.
      Closeable DefaultObservable.register(Observer<? super T> observer) 
      static <T> void Reactive.run(Observable<? extends T> source, Observer<? super T> observer)
      Blocks until the observable calls finish() or error().
      Method parameters in hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.reactive with type arguments of type Observer 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> Observable<T> Reactive.create(Func1<Observer<? super T>,? extends Action0> subscribe)
      Create an observable instance by submitting a function which takes responsibility for registering observers.
      static <T> Observable<T> Reactive.createWithCloseable(Func1<Observer<? super T>,? extends Closeable> subscribe)
      Create an observable instance by submitting a function which takes responsibility for registering observers and returns a custom Closeable to terminate the registration.

    • Uses of Observer in hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.swing

      Classes in hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.swing that implement Observer 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SwingObservables.ObservableActionListener
      The observable action listener which relays the actionPerformed() calls to next() calls.
      static class  SwingObservables.ObservableAdjustmentListener
      The observable adjustment listener which relays adjustmentValueChanged() events to next().
      static class  SwingObservables.ObservableChangeListener
      The observable change listener which relays the stateChanged() calls to next() calls.
      static class  SwingObservables.ObservableDocumentListener
      The observable document listener which relays the insertUpdate(), removeUpdate() and changedUpdate() events to next() calls.
      static class  SwingObservables.ObservableItemListener
      The observable item listener which relays events from ItemListener.
      static class  SwingObservables.ObservableKeyListener
      The observable key listener which collects the keyTyped(), keyPressed(), keyReleased() events and relays it to next().
      static class  SwingObservables.ObservableListDataListener
      The observable list data listener which relays the intervalAdded(), intervalRemoved() and contentsChanged() events to next() calls.
      static class  SwingObservables.ObservableListSelectionListener
      The observable list selection listener which relays the valueChanged() events to next().
      static class  SwingObservables.ObservableMouseListener
      The observable mouse listener which relays all mouse related events (movement, clicks, wheel) to next().
      static class  SwingObservables.ObservableWindowListener
      The observable window listener which relays events from WindowListener, WindowFocusListener and WindowStateListener.
      Methods in hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.swing with parameters of type Observer 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> T SwingObservables.create(Class<T> listener, Observer<? super Dynamic> bindTo)
      Create a dynamic observer for the given listener interface by proxying all method calls.
